summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from June 8, 2020, discussing the status of the investigation into Prince Andrew's connection to the Epstein case. It references a Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request submitted in April 2020 and notes that the Southern District of New York (SDNY) is still reviewing digital evidence.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Addressed in an email by another FBI agent seeking an update on the investigation and the MLAT request related to Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: The subject of an MLAT request and investigation by the FBI and SDNY, with prosecutors in New York seeking to speak with him regarding the Epstein case.

connections.description: Sean, an FBI agent, is involved in the investigation concerning Prince Andrew, as indicated by the email seeking updates on the MLAT request and investigation status.

events.title: MLAT Request Submission
events.description: A Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request was submitted concerning Prince Andrew's connection to the Epstein case.

events.title: Internal FBI Email Discussion
events.description: FBI agents exchanged emails discussing the status of the Prince Andrew investigation, the MLAT request, and SDNY's review of digital evidence.

keyFacts: An MLAT request regarding Prince Andrew was submitted in April 2020 as part of the Epstein investigation.
As of June 8, 2020, the Southern District of New York was still reviewing digital evidence related to the case.
The email references a news article from The Hill indicating prosecutors in New York had asked to speak with Prince Andrew.
The communication shows ongoing coordination and status inquiries among FBI agents regarding the Prince Andrew investigation.
